item.title: “Our Forgotten Neighbours” leave their weekly rubbish, 30th July
item.description:

item.title: Dangerous driving, 30th July
item.description:
Hi there for the past few months there has been a increase in dangerous drivers on Straightsmouth. There have been many times when cars have raced up and down Straightsmouth revving the engine and sometimes parking up and having gatherings around their cars, rowdy young man and women who also litter the road dropping their rubbish out of their cars and whatever they have on them. This happens sometimes very late at night but also happens generally. The dangerous driving is very concerning not only because there is a primary school nearby but also because of the people who live on Straightsmouth some of which are elderly. There are also a lot of dogs and cats living on this road. There is a speed bump but it is very low and doesn't slow anyone down. Perhaps it could be made bigger to help the situation. Or more could be put in or a speed camera? Huge thank you and please help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manchester Grove, Isle of Dogs, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation blocking pavement completely, 30th July
item.description:
The vegetation from private land has been left to grow out of control and is now blocking the pavement completely, meaning that everyone including disabled people and those with children have to walk in the road. The community from the private land has complained to the agents and nothing is being done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Okemore Gardens, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picton Street, Camberwell, London

item.title: Bed frame board -dumped at Hickman Walk/Woolwich new road, 30th July
item.description:
Hi team, it’s been a few days and white colour bed frame board has been left on the wall by Hickman Walk-Woolwich New Rd . It’s blocking the pavement where pedestrians walk. Could you please arrange for it to be removed asap? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich New Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Relentless Littering, urinating and dog poo on Straightsmouth, 30th July
item.description:
Hi there Since the Maritime Cut sark DLR station has been shut there has been a huge increase of littering on Straightsmouth , especially towards the top before you enter the main road by the Cinema and the Mitre pub. Broken glass, fly tipping , plastic bottles , cigarettes , general rubbish everywhere in the road, the pavements and in the gutters by the side of the pavements. Straightsmouth needs extra attention as it is a school route and now also the main road people use to get to central Greenwich. There is also a rise in dog poo and people often use the carpark by the passageway as a place to urinate. Please can we have special attention given to this street? We would be so grateful. It's a really bad problem now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manchester Grove, Isle of Dogs, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ruxley roundabout left lane closures, 30th July
item.description:
The unnecessary left lane closures on the roundabout are causing big queues towards the roundabout in all directions. There is no need for the closures as drivers can still exit the roundabout at North Cray Road using the right lane. I urge you to reconsider the blanket closing of left lanes in these circumstances. It is causing traffic jams for no safety gain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruxley Corner, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greville Road, South Hampstead, London
